items.title: Cloudflare is luring web-scraping bots into an ‘AI Labyrinth’
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- Cloudflare has launched AI Labyrinth, a tool to combat web-scraping bots.
- The tool lures harmful crawlers into decoy pages to waste their resources.
- It identifies and fingerprints malicious bots to improve defenses.
- Website administrators can opt in via the Cloudflare dashboard.
- AI Labyrinth aims to develop networks of linked URLs to further trap bots.

items.title: Photo Mode is my new gaming obsession
items.author: Ash Parrish
items.summary:
- The author has become obsessed with photo modes in the games *Infinity Nikki* and *Assassin’s Creed Shadows* due to their detailed environments and textures.
- Photo mode allows players to capture professional-grade images, a feature that has gained prominence in modern gaming.
- Initially indifferent to photo modes, the author found satisfaction in experimenting with photo features in both games, leading to a newfound appreciation for video game photography.
- Key moments in the games prompted the author to capture images, reshaping their perception of photo mode from a trivial feature to a form of creative expression.
- The experience has motivated the author to improve their game photography skills, with aspirations to apply these skills in real life.

items.title: SwitchBot adds robot vacuums, smart shades, and its new Hub 3 to Home Assistant
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- SwitchBot will integrate over 45 products with Home Assistant in the first half of 2025.
- Notable new products include the SwitchBot Hub 3, Robot Vacuum K10 Plus Pro, and Curtain 3 smart shades.
- Many integrations are expected to roll out in April 2025.
- The integration is seen as beneficial for users as it enhances compatibility with various smart home devices amid challenges with undocumented software changes.

items.title: 7 cool indie games from GDC 2025
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- The Game Developers Conference 2025 showcased unreleased indie games alongside major titles like Nintendo Switch 2 and Grand Theft Auto VI.
- Featured games include:
  - **Dreams of Another**: A shooter that creates the world instead of destroying it, featuring unique graphics and gameplay.
  - **Faraway**: A simple game where players, as a shooting star, create constellations with one-button gameplay.
  - **Haste: Broken Worlds**: A fast-paced roguelike game where players navigate procedurally generated levels.
  - **Herdling**: A herding game focused on guiding fluffy beasts through various environments.
  - **Hotel Barcelona**: A collaboration between game creators Suda51 and Swery65 offering a challenging roguelike horror experience.
  - **My Arms Are Longer Now**: A slapstick game where players use stretchy arms to steal items without detection.
  - **To a T**: A quirky game featuring a teenager stuck in a T-pose, exploring themes of identity and fears in a whimsical setting, set to release on May 28th.

items.title: The Best Laptops You Can Get
items.author: Antonio G. Di Benedetto
items.summary:
- Overall pick for most users is the [MacBook Air M4 model](https://www.theverge.com/reviews/627186/apple-macbook-air-m4-13-15-inch-2025-laptop-review) due to its portability and battery life.
- Alternatives include gaming laptops, Chromebooks, and unique models like the [16-inch MacBook Pro](https://www.theverge.com/24319419/apple-macbook-pro-m4-max-pro-review-price-specs).
- Criteria for good laptops include performance, solid build quality, battery life, and features like good keyboards and trackpads.
- The M4 MacBook Air is priced starting at $999 for the 13-inch and $1,199 for the 15-inch with better specs available at a higher price.

items.title: Fujifilm GFX100RF review: one sensor, nine cameras
items.author: David Imel
items.summary:
- Fujifilm GFX100RF aims to combine nine cameras and four lenses into one compact body with a 102MP sensor.
- Features an aspect ratio dial allowing selection from nine formats reminiscent of vintage film cameras.
- Virtual zoom capabilities offer four focal lengths: 35mm, 45mm, 63mm, and 80mm with reduced resolutions.
- The camera's compact design enhances portability but lacks in-body stabilization and has a minimum aperture of f/4.
- Price set at $4,899, making it the cheapest GFX body currently available, but not as fast or stabilized as competitors like the Leica Q3.

items.title: People keep putting fake walls in front of Teslas
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- YouTuber Mark Rober's fake wall test for Tesla FSD prompted a new video by Kyle Paul addressing FSD's obstacle detection capabilities.
- Paul's video features a Tesla Model Y with HW3 and a Cybertruck with HW4, testing FSD’s response to a Wile E. Coyote-style fake wall.
- The Model Y failed to detect the wall, while the Cybertruck successfully slowed down and stopped before hitting it.

items.title: It’s time to squad up in this preview from Apple’s Mythic Quest spinoff series
No DEI allowed for US mergers and acquisitions, says the new FCC chair
Lyft’s robotaxis will launch in Atlanta this summer
Lawmakers are trying to repeal Section 230 again
The best MagSafe and Qi2 chargers
items.author: Antonio G. Di Benedetto
items.summary:
- Wireless charging offers convenience though it's generally less efficient than wired charging.
- Qi2 chargers are recommended for iPhones from the 12 series onwards, providing up to 15W charging, equivalent to MagSafe except for iPhone 16 which can charge at 25W.
- Qi2 is an open standard and typically less expensive than MagSafe options, with a wider range of chargers available.
- Samsung Galaxy S25 devices are Qi2 ready, requiring a special magnetic case to utilize the full charging speed on Qi2 chargers.
- Qi2 certification ensures proper charging performance and magnet alignment, replacing older MagSafe-compatible chargers.

items.title: Drama over quantum computing’s future heats up
items.author: Sophia Chen
items.summary:
- On March 18, Chetan Nayak of Microsoft presented quantum chip data at the American Physical Society summit amid ongoing skepticism.
- Microsoft claims a new topological qubit is less prone to errors, but researchers are doubtful of the evidence.
- Controversy stems from Microsoft's past retraction of similar claims and concerns over the timeline for useful quantum computing applications.
- Experts predict a decade before quantum computers become useful for practical applications, with current research focusing on reducing errors and scaling up qubits.
- Governments and private sectors are investing heavily in quantum technology, but overhype risks a potential 'quantum winter' due to inflated expectations.

items.title: The best iPad deals you can get
items.author: Brandon Widder
items.summary:
- Best iPad deals available outside major sales events like Black Friday and Amazon Prime Day.
- Ongoing discounts on various iPad models, including 10th-gen iPad, iPad Air, iPad Mini, and iPad Pro.
- Current pricing details: 10th-gen iPad starting at **$269**, 11th-gen iPad at **$329**, iPad Mini at **$399**, and iPad Air at **$499**.
- New 2025 iPad models feature A16 and M3 chips with notable speed improvements and storage options.
- Discounts found at major retailers including Walmart, Amazon, and Best Buy.

items.title: Watch this ultra-detailed animation of the seafloor
items.author: Justine Calma
items.summary:
- NASA released a video showing a detailed new map of the ocean floor enabled by the SWOT satellite.
- The SWOT satellite, launched in 2022, has provided higher-resolution data compared to previous mapping technologies.
- Maps created from SWOT data enhance submarine navigation and assist in laying and repairing underwater communication cables.
- The gravity-based mapping technique reveals features like abyssal hills and seamounts, which cover about 70% of the ocean floor.
- While sonar ships have mapped only about a quarter of the ocean floor, SWOT dramatically improves the process.
- The primary mission of SWOT is to measure the height of water over oceans, rivers, and lakes, aimed at a comprehensive survey of Earth's surface water.

items.title: Google will let you make AI podcasts from Gemini’s Deep Research
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Google’s Gemini app now allows the generation of Audio Overviews based on Deep Research reports.
- Users can create a conversational podcast featuring two AI hosts from in-depth reports.
- The feature was introduced to enhance the Audio Overviews that began within the AI note-taking app NotebookLM last September.
- Recent updates allow customization and interaction with hosts.
- The ‘Generate Audio Overview’ option can be used after Gemini generates a report for listening purposes.

items.title: How ‘Careless People’ is becoming a bigger problem for Meta
items.author: Alex Heath
items.summary:
- Meta is attempting to discredit Sarah Wynn-Williams, author of *Careless People*, her memoir about working at the company.
- Wynn-Williams filed an emergency motion to dismiss a gag order preventing her from discussing the book.
- Her book has attracted interest from Congress and governments due to claims about Meta's coordination with the Chinese Communist Party and exploitation of vulnerable teens.
- Zuckerberg's political alignment with the Trump administration raises questions in light of these allegations.
- Critics challenge details in Wynn-Williams' book, alleging factual inaccuracies and exaggerations.
- Some former Facebook employees endorse the book for capturing the Silicon Valley work environment's essence.

items.title: ICE is going after more international students
items.author: Gaby Del Valle
items.summary:
- Mahmoud Khalil, a graduate student at Columbia University, was detained by immigration agents for pro-Palestine protest involvement.
- DHS has arrested additional students, including Badar Khan Suri from Georgetown University, who is accused of posing a threat to US foreign policy.
- A federal judge has temporarily barred the deportation of Suri, who is being held at an ICE detention center in Louisiana.
- Claims of Suri's alleged connection to Hamas are based on family ties; his wife is a US citizen.
- Momodou Taal, a Cornell University student, has also been targeted for political activism and fears retaliation for his criticisms of US foreign policy.
- Taal's attorneys report that the DOJ intends to serve him with a Notice to Appear in immigration court.

items.title: Samsung admits its bad software update bricked a lot of soundbars
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Samsung confirmed that a software update error caused issues with certain 2024 soundbar devices.
- Affected models include flagship HW-Q990D, HW-Q800D, and HW-S801D.
- Samsung is offering free repairs for impacted units, regardless of warranty status.
- Users reported devices were unresponsive and could not be factory reset after the update.
- Physical repairs are needed, as it cannot be fixed with another software update.

items.title: Alexa Plus is coming to almost every Echo — but your favorite skill might not make the cut
items.author: Jennifer Pattison Tuohy
items.summary: - Alexa Plus, a new AI-powered voice assistant, will be available on Echo devices in the coming weeks. - Available on Echo Show 8, 10, 15, and 21, Fire TV devices, Fire tablets, and the web, but not on older Echo devices. - Users can sign up for early access via the Alexa Plus landing page. - Free during early access; will eventually require a $19.99/month subscription or Amazon Prime. - Alexa Plus can process multiple commands and understand natural language, responding to user emotion. - Not all existing Alexa skills will be available at launch; some users may lose their favorite skills.

items.title: Perplexity wants to buy TikTok and open-source its algorithm
items.author: Kylie Robison
items.summary:
- Perplexity proposed a bid to acquire TikTok and transform its platform.
- The bid aims to rebuild TikTok’s algorithm in the U.S. with an emphasis on transparency and open source.
- Key proposals include integrating AI tech, enhancing personalization, and adding multilingual capabilities.
- ByteDance's sale reluctance, previous legal challenges, and competitive bids from larger companies complicate the process.
- Analysts estimate TikTok’s U.S. operations value between $30-$50 billion and uncertainty exists around the seriousness of Perplexity's bid.

items.title: Best Early Deals from Amazon’s Spring Sales Event
items.author: Brandon Widder
items.summary:
- Amazon’s Big Spring Sale starts on March 25 and runs until March 31, 2025.
- Discounts available on various products including security cameras, smartwatches, and portable speakers.
- Notable early deals include:
  - [Google Pixel Tablet](https://www.amazon.com/Google-Pixel-Tablet-Extra-Long-Porcelain/dp/B0CZMFZ84J?tag=theverge02-20) for $279, featuring Tensor G2 chip and 11-inch LCD display.
  - [Sonos Ray](https://www.amazon.com/Sonos-Essential-Soundbar-Music-Video/dp/B0B2KQFTG9/?tag=theverge02-20) soundbar for $179.
  - [Blink Mini 2](https://www.amazon.com/Blink-Mini-2-TwoCameras-White/dp/B0BWX39R5W/?tag=theverge02-20) smart camera for $20 with weather resistance.

items.title: Yahoo is selling TechCrunch
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Yahoo has sold TechCrunch to the private equity firm Regent for an undisclosed sum.
- This sale follows a recent acquisition of Foundry, which operates tech sites like PCWorld and Macworld.
- TechCrunch has experienced multiple ownership changes since AOL acquired it in 2010, followed by Verizon's acquisition of AOL and Yahoo.
- Yahoo will maintain a small interest in TechCrunch post-sale.

items.title: Elon Musk is paying voters again ahead of the Wisconsin Supreme Court election
items.author: Mia Sato
items.summary:
- Elon Musk's America PAC is offering $100 to registered voters who sign a petition against 'activist judges' in Wisconsin.
- This is a similar tactic to what Musk employed before the presidential election, where he promised money for petition signatures.
- The legality of this offer is debated, as it doesn't explicitly require individuals to vote.
- The Wisconsin Supreme Court election, scheduled for April 1, 2024, is critical for determining the ideological balance of the court.
- Over $76 million has been spent on this election, with Musk’s groups contributing over $14 million to support conservative candidate Brad Schimel, who is currently trailing.
- The petition process collects voter information, potentially allowing targeted campaigning in the lead-up to the election.
- Musk's interest in this election is also linked to Tesla's legal battles in Wisconsin over dealership regulations.

items.title: Anker’s small and light 45W USB-C charger is now even smaller and lighter
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- Anker's new 45W Nano charger measures 1.45 inches long and weighs 52 grams.
- It is 17 grams lighter than the previous model, the Nano II 713.
- The charger is available on [Amazon](https://www.amazon.com/Anker-Nano-Charger-USB-C-Cable/dp/B0DPKRC84P??tag=theverge02-20) for $34.99, including a six-foot USB-C cable.
- Supports Samsung's Super Fast Charging, allowing the Samsung S25 Ultra to charge to 70% in 30 minutes.
- Its dimensions are 1.30 × 1.26 × 1.45 inches when including the bundled cable's weight, totaling 58 grams.

items.title: Elon Musk made more promises about Optimus and Cybercabs at Tesla's surprise all-hands meeting
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- Elon Musk held a surprise all-hands meeting for Tesla employees in Texas to address stock declines and future plans.
- Promised significant developments for the Cybercab robotaxi and Optimus humanoid robot, claiming production of 5,000 Optimus robots this year.
- Discussed a revolutionary manufacturing process for Cybercab that could produce one unit in under five seconds, with a projected price of $30,000 by 2026.

items.title: Opening iOS is good news for smartwatches
items.author: Victoria Song
items.summary:
- The European Commission has mandated Apple to open up iOS interoperability to other device manufacturers.
- This change will allow third-party smartwatches to interact with iOS notifications, enhancing user experience.
- Apple's previous restrictions limited the functionality of third-party devices compared to Apple Watches, which offered seamless integration with iOS devices.
- Critics, including Apple, argue that this move could stifle innovation by forcing the company to share features with competitors.
- Lack of recent innovation in smartwatches has contributed to stagnant market interest, leading to a desire for more creativity and options in smartwatch design.

items.title: Bigscreen’s Super Light Beyond 2 Headset Adds Optional Eye-Tracking
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Bigscreen revealed the Beyond 2 custom-fit virtual reality headset, which features a 116-degree field of view.
- The headset weighs 107 grams and starts at $1,019, with additional costs for eye-tracking features.
- Compatible with SteamVR base stations and offers a 5120 x 2560 resolution at up to 90Hz refresh rate with upgraded optics.
- A Beyond 2e version, starting at $1,219, includes eye-tracking capabilities.
- Custom 3D face scans can be made with an iPhone XR or newer, or a universal-fit mount is available.
- Available for order now, with shipments expected in June 2025.

items.title: The FCC is probing Chicago public radio station WBEZ over on-air sponsorships
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- The FCC is investigating WBEZ and 12 other NPR and PBS stations over their on-air sponsorship practices.
- Initiated by FCC Chair Brendan Carr in January, the probe examines compliance with underwriting regulations that prohibit commercial advertisements.
- WBEZ received an information request from the FCC on February 28, with a response deadline at the end of March.
- An unnamed spokesperson stated WBEZ is confident in their adherence to FCC guidelines.
- Carr expresses concern that underwriting may cross into prohibited advertising, affecting funding for NPR and PBS.
- WBEZ's financial struggles include a report that 4.6% of its revenue came from public funding, totaling around $1.47 million, amid significant staff buyouts.

items.title: GM blocks dealership from installing Apple CarPlay retrofit kits in EVs
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
• GM has shut down a dealership’s Apple CarPlay retrofit service for EVs, citing safety concerns.
• The closure follows GM's previous removal of Apple CarPlay and Android Auto from its EVs.
• A third-party kit developed by White Automotive was previously offered but is now listed as discontinued due to GM's intervention.
• The decision raises questions about the impacts on customer satisfaction and aftermarket services.

items.title: Coca-Cola’s new hydrogen-powered vending machine doesn’t need a power outlet
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- Coca-Cola is set to install the world’s first hydrogen-powered vending machines at the World Expo 2025 in Osaka, Japan, starting April 13th, 2025.
- Co-developed with Fuji Electric, these machines operate without a power outlet, using replaceable hydrogen cartridges for electricity generation.
- A total of 58 vending machines will be installed, featuring displays to educate visitors on hydrogen power; however, details on the longevity of the hydrogen cartridges have not been disclosed.

items.title: Pokémon TCG Pocket is getting in on the shiny hype
items.author: Charles Pulliam-Moore
items.summary:
- Pokémon TCG Pocket announces new expansion, Shining Revelry, launching on March 27th.
- The set features shiny versions of popular Pokémon such as Charizard, Pachirisu, and Lucario, along with new characters from recent Switch games.
- Ranked competitive matches will start on March 27th with a related event running until April 26th.
- Shiny Charizard-themed in-game accessories will become available starting April 1st, likely through player objectives.

items.title: Severance brought everything together in its season 2 finale
items.author: Andrew Webster
items.summary:
- The season 2 finale of *Severance* titled "Cold Harbor" successfully addressed many lingering mysteries without feeling forced.
- Mark's journey involved coordinating between his innie and outie versions to rescue Gemma, revealing the connection of multiple Gemma variants to Lumon’s experiments.
- Lumon’s ultimate goal was identified as a “war against pain,” which involves transforming Gemma into an unfeeling version of herself through her variants.
- The finale balanced humor and horror, tying together major plot lines while leaving some questions open for the future, leading into the newly confirmed season 3.

items.title: Trump's confusing crusade against Big Tech
items.author: David Pierce
items.summary:
- President Trump has shifted from wanting to ban TikTok to attempting to save it, amidst discussions of regulatory plans.
- The administration is actively seeking regulations on Big Tech while appearing friendly to top executives.
- Significant tech news includes Apple facing issues with Siri and the return of Pebble smartwatches, alongside new launches from Google and Huawei.
- Discussion includes insights into the TikTok ban, the state of broadband equity initiatives, and ongoing FTC challenges.
- The Vergecast features commentary on a Cybertruck recall, the drama surrounding the book *Careless People*, and Netflix's competitive edge against Apple TV Plus.

items.title: Severance is returning for season 3
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Apple CEO Tim Cook confirmed the renewal of *Severance* for Season 3 in a reply to producer Ben Stiller.
- The announcement came on the same day as the Season 2 finale debut on Apple TV Plus.
- Producer Ben Stiller indicated that there won’t be another three-year gap between seasons.
- Filming of Season 2 was delayed due to the Hollywood strikes in 2023.
- The show stars Adam Scott as Mark Scout, with other cast members including Brit Lower, Zach Cherry, Tramell Tillman, and Christopher Walken.

items.title: Samsung’s Galaxy Tab S10 FE Plus will be bigger and cost more
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- A leak has revealed details about the upcoming Samsung Galaxy Tab S10 FE and S10 FE Plus.
- The Galaxy Tab S10 FE Plus features a larger 13.1-inch display, compared to its predecessor's 12.4-inch display.
- The Tab S10 FE will maintain the 10.9-inch size of the previous model.
- There's no confirmation on whether the new models will have OLED displays or an improved refresh rate.
- The FE Plus will have a single 13MP rear camera, dropping the ultrawide camera from previous models.
- Both tablets will be powered by Exynos 1580 chips instead of MediaTek processors used in the main S10 line.
- Pricing starts at €579 for the Galaxy Tab S10 FE and €749 for the S10 FE Plus, both €50 higher than their predecessors.
- US pricing is expected to be similar, with a potential $50 increase.

items.title: ChatGPT accused of saying an innocent man murdered his children
items.author: Dominic Preston
items.summary:
- A Norwegian man, Arve Hjalmar Holmen, filed a privacy complaint against OpenAI after ChatGPT falsely claimed he was a convicted murderer.
- The chatbot included fictitious details about his life, alleging he had killed two children and attempted to kill a third.
- Advocacy group Noyb filed the complaint, arguing OpenAI violated GDPR by spreading false information.
- Noyb demands a fine and improvements to prevent such errors.
- This is Noyb’s second complaint regarding ChatGPT’s inaccuracies, following a prior incident involving a public figure's incorrect date of birth.

items.title: Heathrow airport shutdown creates travel chaos
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- Heathrow airport closed due to a major fire at a nearby electrical substation, affecting thousands of flights.
- The airport will remain closed until at least midnight on Friday for safety reasons.
- 1,357 flights scheduled for today have been disrupted, with 120 flights returning to origin or diverted.
- Passengers advised not to travel to the airport and to check with airlines for information.
- This is the first complete closure of Heathrow since the 2010 Eyjafjallajokull volcano eruption.
- Over 16,000 homes in the area are also facing power outages due to the fire, which is now under control but under investigation.

items.title: The crypto bars are invading Washington
items.author: Tina Nguyen
items.summary:
- A popular DC bar for Republicans will be replaced by Pubkey, a bar that exclusively accepts cryptocurrency.  
- Pubkey, known for its casual vibe and bitcoin focus, will open in DC, confirming its commitment to creating a bipartisan space.  
- The bar's opening follows Trump’s high-profile bitcoin transaction at a Pubkey location in New York, highlighting the growing influence of the crypto community.

items.title: The System Shock 2 remaster comes out June 26th
items.author: Adi Robertson
items.summary:
- Nightdive Studios is releasing a remastered version of *System Shock 2*, first announced on March 20.
- The remaster, titled *System Shock 2: 25th Anniversary Remaster*, will be available on June 26th for PC, Xbox One, Xbox Series X|S, and PlayStation 4 and 5.
- Visual updates include sharper enemy models and visible hands holding weapons, while maintaining the original game's feel.
- New interface supports console-friendly controls, including DualSense support and a quickbar for weapons and abilities.
- Features cross-play for cooperative multiplayer and integrates existing community mods and the SS2 Community Patch.

items.title: US Attorney General Announces Severe Charges Against Alleged Tesla Arsonists
items.author: Richard Lawler
items.summary:
- Attorney General Pam Bondi announced charges against three individuals responsible for vandalism at Tesla properties.
- Charges include malicious destruction of property and possession of Molotov cocktails, related to incidents at Tesla locations.
- Recent arrests came after multiple reports of vandalism, including arson at Tesla stations in South Carolina and other states.

items.title: Google sues alleged scammers over 10,000 fake Maps listings
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- Google is suing a network of scammers behind the creation of over 10,000 fake business listings on Google Maps.
- The lawsuit was prompted by reports from a Texas-based locksmith being impersonated.
- Google has removed or blocked 12 million fake business profiles in 2023 and noted an increase in fake listings year over year.
- Scammers exploit fake listings to mislead victims, providing services at inflated prices or directing them to deceptive call centers.
- Google has strengthened its efforts to combat fake reviews and deceptive engagement practices, especially under regulatory pressure in the UK.

items.title: Apple TV Plus is reportedly losing $1 billion per year
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Apple TV Plus is losing over $1 billion annually despite having 45 million subscribers in 2024.
- The platform is the only Apple subscription not generating profit.
- Apple cut its content budget for Apple TV Plus by $500 million from an initial $5 billion.
- Apple TV Plus captures less than 1% of monthly streaming services viewership, compared to Netflix’s 8.2%.
- The service was created to bolster the Apple ecosystem, with no current marketing strategy beyond that.
- Apple's other services like Music, News Plus, and Fitness Plus are also struggling with low usage and profits.

items.title: Karma bets on EREVs and ultra-luxury for its latest reboot
items.author: Tim Stevens
items.summary:
- Marques McCammon is the new president of Karma Automotive, aiming to position the brand as a top ultra-luxury vehicle manufacturer in the US.
- Karma Automotive, originally born from Fisker, is rebooting its lineup, moving from the previously announced Kaveya to the new Amaris EREV.
- The Amaris will feature a new four-cylinder engine, enhanced battery chemistry for better performance, and is set to launch in late 2026, priced significantly higher than the current Revero.
- Karma plans to shift away from sourcing battery cells from China amid market demands and potential tariffs, complicating their supply chain.

items.title: Segway is recalling over 200,000 electric scooters that can collapse mid-ride
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- Segway has recalled Ninebot Max G30P and Max G30LP electric scooters due to a collapse hazard.
- The recall affects around 220,000 scooters sold since January 2020 at major retailers like Best Buy and Amazon.
- 68 reports of failures have resulted in 20 injuries including serious ones.
- Consumers are advised to stop using the scooters and contact Segway for a free maintenance kit to adjust the folding mechanism.

items.title: Comcast and Spectrum join in on the satellite messaging wave
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Galaxy S25 and Pixel 9 owners on Xfinity Mobile and Spectrum Mobile can send emergency messages via satellite.
- Launch date for this feature was March 20, 2025.
- Customers must have Galaxy S25 or Google Pixel 9 to access the satellite messaging.
- Comcast and Charter's feature follows Verizon's similar rollout for the same devices.
- This service is supported by Skylo, which previously worked with Google on Pixel 9's Satellite SOS.
- Currently, users can only send messages without Wi-Fi or cellular data; receiving SMS over satellite is expected in the coming weeks.
- This move aligns Comcast and Charter with other companies exploring satellite connectivity for mobile devices.

items.title: Netflix has a new plan for games
items.author: Andrew Webster
items.summary:
- Netflix's gaming strategy has been inconsistent since its launch in 2021.
- New president of games Alain Tascan aims to focus on four game categories: narrative, multiplayer party games, children's games, and mainstream releases.
- The strategy resembles Netflix's early approach to original programming, starting small before expanding.
- Netflix plans to scale back on areas like indie game support and previously shut down an internal AAA studio.
- The ultimate goal is to make games easily accessible and playable on any device within five years, similar to the cross-play success of Fortnite.
- New TV-focused games are set to launch by the end of this year, aiming to eliminate the need for controllers.

items.title: The EU wants Apple to open these iOS features to other gadgets
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- The European Union has mandated Apple to enhance the interoperability of iOS, detailing features for other devices.
- New guidelines require Apple to open nine iOS-exclusive connectivity features by the end of 2025 to comply with the Digital Markets Act.
- Key features include access to iOS notifications for third-party smartwatches and enabling apps to run in the background for better updates.
- Additional requirements involve allowing third-party headphones to utilize features like SharePlay and audio switching.
- Apple must enable data sharing via AirDrop and AirPlay with non-Apple devices and ease setup for third-party gadget connections.
- Non-compliance could lead to investigations and fines of up to 10% of Apple's annual turnover.

items.title: Here's the Steam on Xbox evidence Microsoft didn't want you to see
items.author: Tom Warren
items.summary:
- Microsoft hinted at a new Xbox UI that may include support for Steam games.
- The UI was briefly revealed in a now-removed post, showing Steam labels on devices.
- Sources indicate that Microsoft is working on an Xbox app update to display games installed on PC, including those from Steam and Epic Games Store.
- Phil Spencer has suggested potential future integration of PC store titles into Xbox consoles.

items.title: An easy to read and interpret title for the article as a string.
items.author: Sarah Jeong
items.summary:
- President Trump fired Democratic commissioners Alvaro Bedoya and Rebecca Kelly Slaughter at the FTC, violating longstanding legal precedent from 1935.
- Outlets including The Verge faced backlash for using cautious language in their headlines, which did not clearly state the firings were illegal.
- The legality of the firings is likely to be challenged in court, with implications for presidential power and the independence of the FTC.
